meanings.definition: To make subtle or refined distinctions in thought or language.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys subtilizing the various shades of blue in the painting.
meanings.sent2: He is skilled at subtilizing the differences between two similar arguments.
meanings.sent3: While subtilizing the menu options, she accidentally ordered the wrong dish.
meanings.sent4: Subtilizing the emotions of others is like deciphering a complex puzzle.
meanings.sent5: Subtilizing the intricate details of the poem brought a new level of appreciation.

meanings.definition: To perceive or understand subtle distinctions or differences.
meanings.sent1: The detective was subtilizing the clues to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent2: She was subtilizing the hidden meanings behind his words.
meanings.sent3: Subtilizing the subtle changes in the weather, he predicted a storm was coming.
meanings.sent4: Subtilizing the delicate balance of nature is essential for environmental scientists.
meanings.sent5: Subtilizing the nuances of the music added depth to her enjoyment of the concert.
